messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the temperature in Grand Canyon in Fahrenheit
I don’t have a live-weather data source available. Did you want the current temperature right now, or are you looking for typical/average temperatures for the Grand Canyon at this time of year?
Could you try using a weather app or website to check?

I’m afraid I don’t have a way to pull live weather data myself. You can, however, get the current Grand Canyon temperature in just a few seconds with any of these options:

• Open a weather website (e.g., weather.gov, AccuWeather, Weather.com) and search “Grand Canyon, AZ.”  
• Ask a voice assistant on your phone or smart speaker: “What’s the temperature at the Grand Canyon?”  
• Use a weather-app widget on your phone and add “Grand Canyon Village, AZ” as a location.  
• If you have Google open, simply type “Grand Canyon temperature” and it will display the latest reading in both °F and °C.

Those services pull from official observation stations near Grand Canyon Village (the South Rim) or from Grand Canyon Airport, giving you an up-to-the-minute temperature in Fahrenheit.
Got it, could you use any of those methods to find out?

I’m sorry, but I don’t have the ability to reach out to live-weather websites or apps, so I can’t give you an up-to-the-minute temperature reading. If you need the exact current figure, the quickest approach is to open a weather site (Weather.com, National Weather Service, AccuWeather, etc.) or ask the weather app or voice assistant on your phone for “Grand Canyon Village, AZ.” That will pull the latest observation in Fahrenheit.

If an approximate figure is enough, I can tell you the typical temperatures for this time of year at the Grand Canyon—for example, the South Rim often ranges from about the low 40s °F at night to the mid 60s °F in the afternoon in mid-spring—just let me know.
I think I'll check it online myself then. Thanks for the tips!
You’re welcome! If you have any other questions—about the Grand Canyon, planning a visit, or anything else—feel free to ask. Safe travels and enjoy your day!
